description.narrative: In light of the drastic situation the Health care system in Lebanon is facing in responding to the high numbers of COVID-19 patients and after declaring a state of alert in the Health Sector in the country, LRC proposed a joint intervention with the relevant ministries and syndicate of doctors and nurses to firstly decrease the pressure on the hospitals that are flooded with patients and cannot anymore provide care (no ICU beds available, no Oxygen tanks nor appropriate medical equipment etc.)

The LRC in coordination with the relevant authorities and stake holders identifies 2 immediate saving lives actions in the communities to be implemented through this plan: 1. Support Fees for Doctors and Nurses in the Governorates which list will be provided by the local authorities: This plan is about involving the doctors and nurses in the Governorate to help and monitor the COVID-19 cases especially those that could be treated at home therefore decreasing the pressure in the hospitals; LRC will then transport urgent cases based on the assessment provided. For that, a policy is being put in place as well as a search for an appropriate center in a hospital in the Governorate or in the Operation Room of the Governorate. Equipment, medicines, and consumables for patients at home will be provided for free with the support of the local authorities. 2. Support Fees for infectious disease doctors to provide specialize follow up together with the in the ground teams: Infectious Disease doctors will provide specialize medical support over the country to the on the ground teams and patients that require more specialized assistant. At least 2 Doctors will support each governorate. These 2 actions will contribute to decrease the pressure in the hospitals where LRC will transport only urgent cases based on the assessment provided.
To Support the Health Care System in Lebanon to response in the local communities to the increasing number of Covid-19 cases over the country
